15:26 <+sburjan> Tomorrow I will be working until 13:00 PM RO time, 12:00 Paris time  
15:36 <thebishop> has joined #xwiki  
15:40 <+sburjan> I see people using LDAP App, thus erasing their rights. we should put a warning or something until this is fixed  
15:53 <+tmortagne> or remove the dependency on admin app  
15:54 <+tmortagne> which is unless most of the time in practice since you generally have the admin app already if you install an extension  
15:54 <+tmortagne> we can put it back when the admin app become a real app and not a mess with data that should not be there like now  
15:57 <+tmortagne> sburjan: is there a jira issue about that ?  
15:58 <+tmortagne> found it  
16:00 <+sburjan> yes, I reported it

16:02 <+tmortagne> done

16:10 <+sburjan> let's hope jerome agrees

17:05 <CIA-131> Jean-Vincent Drean stable-4.1.x \* r2242f01 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/2242f0131813be2ba8878307c159a1a7744808b5 / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7911 : Failing migration on Oracle to 4.1 RC1 - http://git.io/eUfnbQ  
17:06 <thebishop> hi xwikiers  
17:07 <thebishop> i see some action was taken on the ldap front  
17:15 <CIA-131> tmortagne master \* r5b2dbf3 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/5b2dbf3e86ff5dc446cf1ab12ddaec6a893435aa / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-ldap/xwiki-platform-ldap-ui/pom.xml : Fix typo - http://git.io/6coB6w  
17:15 <CIA-131> tmortagne stable-4.0.x \* r262f9f3 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/262f9f3882b2cf155cb9c5125d7179f85f6eb6a8 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-ldap/xwiki-platform-ldap-ui/pom.xml : Fix typo - http://git.io/Mvg3EQ  
17:16 <CIA-131> tmortagne stable-4.1.x \* ree3f771 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/ee3f771a17fa7db2c1a6d0d907edfcbcbc0fe7eb / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-ldap/xwiki-platform-ldap-ui/pom.xml : Fix typo - http://git.io/i3QHlQ  
17:16 <+tmortagne> thebishop: not much  
17:16 <+tmortagne> well the version you are comparing to :)  
17:20 <thebishop> tmortagne, yesterday i posted in here that ldap-ui only seems to work with cn as the login.  we use uid for our login and i couldn't make that work  
17:20 <thebishop> is that a known bug?  
17:21 <sburjan> has quit  
17:21 <+tmortagne> thebishop: are you talking about "XWiki + OpenLDAP Invalid credentials problem" on the mailing list ?  
17:22 <thebishop> tmortagne, hmm, i didn't see that but probably.  do you have a url?  
17:23 <+tmortagne> ok tough it was you but this user is not even able to bind to the LDAP server  
17:23 <+tmortagne> sorry if you did it already but you put some debug log on pastebin or something like that  
17:24 <+tmortagne> crap I have to go, back in 20 min  
17:25 <thebishop> ok, i'll be around  
17:40 <+tmortagne> back  
17:41 <+tmortagne> what thing you could check to make sure the UI do its job correction is to go to http://yourdomain/xwiki/bin/edit/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=object  
17:41 <+tmortagne> that's what the UI actually modify  
17:41 <+tmortagne> you have an XWikiPreferences object in there with LDAP related fields at the end  
17:41 <+tmortagne> ( thebishop )  
17:52 <mflorea> has quit

18:00 <CIA-131> tmortagne stable-4.1.x \* rebdff87 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/ebdff87ad0e55c457986710b0c41b3703857a94d / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-handlers/xwiki-platform-extension-handler-xar/src/main/java/org/xwiki/extension/xar/internal/handler/packager/xml/DocumentImporterHandler.java : XWIKI-7914: Installing XAR extension on existing document which is not part of the previous version does not go trough co  
18:06 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
18:12 <ssavi> has joined #xwiki  
18:12 <ries> Good morning! A small question, how do we disable the register button? I tried to remove it from the XWikiAllGroup but it's still showing  
18:13 <@cjd> XWikiAllGroup really ought to be called "RegisteredUsers"  
18:14 <@cjd> try clicking over to Users and then remove register permission for the user called XWikiGuest  
18:15 <ries> We only have a XWikiAdminGroup and XWikiAllGroup  
18:15 <ries> Ooo wait, I miss-read  
18:16 <ries> also no user called XWikiGuest  
18:17 <ries> rights => then click on users  
18:20 <+tmortagne> ries: it's not a group, it's a special user used as "not registered user"  
18:21 <ries> tmortagne: yeaa I found it...  
18:21 <ries> it's hidden behnd that checkbox ..  
18:21 <+tmortagne> XWikiAllGroup actually mean all the registered users  
18:22 <ries> it confused me before indeed…. I don't change permissions to often..  
18:26 <pgmjsd> has joined #xwiki  
18:47 <jamie\_\_wiki> has joined #xwiki  
18:47 <jamie\_\_wiki> Hello  
18:49 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:49 <ries> hello jamie\_\_wiki  
18:49 <jamie\_\_wiki> Is there a way to sort a page's attachments by filename in the attachments tab?  It seems to be sorted by date added or something similar right now..  
18:50 <ries> Is there a special permission required to edit the 'space page' ? when I go to xwiki/bin/edit/Infrastructure/WebHome?section=1 as a normal user then I don't have the rights to edit the space landing page.  
18:50 <ries> Any documents within is not a problem  
18:51 <jamie\_\_wiki> re: sorting a page's attachments, it looks like http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-291 was closed by accident.  
18:52 <jamie\_\_wiki> sorry, I mean that http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-1344 was closed by as a duplicate of http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-291 by accident.  They aren't asking the same thing..  
18:53 <jamie\_\_wiki> On asks abouting showing all documents in a wiki sorted  (XE-291), and the other (XWIKI-1344) is about sorting a page's attachments only..  
18:54 <jamie\_\_wiki> I've got some pages with 40 + attachments, and it becomes a little difficult to find the correct one in the attachments tab.  
18:58 <jamie\_\_wiki> ries: Is your space page a dashboard?  
18:59 <ries> Nhaa, I removed that…. I didn't see the use of a dashboard, so it's just a normal page  
19:01 <jamie\_\_wiki> ries: Can the normal user edit the WebHome without the "?section=1"  
19:01 <ries> let me try  
19:02 <ries> Nope, I did notice this : /xwiki/bin/lock/Infrastructure/WebHome?ajax=1 returns a 204 (no content)  
19:05 <jamie\_\_wiki> Is it possible you were editing it as another user and it's currently locked?  
19:05 <ries> that might be because I have been experimentating with teh superadmin to look at all the permissions  
19:07 <jamie\_\_wiki> Maybe try editing it with admin, then click "cancel" to ensure it's not locked.  Also, if you can view the page, ensure that user also has edit permission, and is not denied edit.  
19:08 <jamie\_\_wiki> Or part of a group that's denied edit..  
19:15 <jamie\_\_wiki> ries: For permissions, if you want to control viewing - try removing the "allowed" view permission for AllWikiUsers at a specific space level, then allow specific groups to view.  Eg. Admins, other groups.  
19:15 <ries> let me try that...  
19:16 <ries> permissions in xwiki sometimes baffles me  
19:17 <jamie\_\_wiki> ries: yes, they're not quite the same as windows file permission etc.   It would be nice to see the effective permissions displayed on the rights tab for a page..  
19:17 <jamie\_\_wiki> (including inherited permissions)  
19:18 <ries> Hmm yes. that would be nice, I don't have experience with Windows though...  
20:02 <lucaa> has quit  
20:19 <thebishop> has quit  
20:20 <@cjd> why do we have 2 ActionExecutedEvent's?  
20:20 <@cjd> org.xwiki.bridge.event.ActionExecutedEvent  
20:20 <@cjd> org.xwiki.observation.event.ActionExecutionEvent  
20:26 <@cjd> ahh ok I see why  
20:44 <CIA-131> Caleb James DeLisle master \* rbc90168 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/bc901688a50e9910ffa9bd8c23d73d4c4bff3456 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-skin/xwiki-platform-skin-skinx/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/plugin/skinx/AbstractDocumentSkinExtensionPlugin.java : XWIKI-7913: Can not register a wiki-level JSX even with PR - http://git.io/ntmxpw  
20:47 <CIA-131> Caleb James DeLisle stable-4.1.x \* rab1adaa https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/ab1adaab86138e9340543c851cf36783fd56f54c / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-skin/xwiki-platform-skin-skinx/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/plugin/skinx/AbstractDocumentSkinExtensionPlugin.java : XWIKI-7913: Can not register a wiki-level JSX even with PR - http://git.io/jtq1sQ  
20:47 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
21:31 <Enygma`> has quit  
21:34 <evalica> has quit  
22:41 <ries> works here  
22:41 <ries> sorry  
23:08 <jamie\_\_wiki> Can someone re-open http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-1344 for me?  I've created a pull request that implements the attachment filename sorting for a page: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/53  
23:09 <jamie\_\_wiki> While I didn't implement it, there could be a drop down choice that changes the request parameter to sort the page's attachment listing by: filename, date, author, etc.  
23:12 <jamie\_\_wiki> That should have been "implements the attachment filename sorting by default", the request parameter can be changed to sort by any valid attachment property.  
23:41 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
23:44 <jvelo> Hi guys  
23:45 <jvelo> I have a strange build behavior with recent version of XAR plugin / XAR handlers  
23:45 <jvelo> seems the XAR dependencies are ignored  
23:45 <jvelo> I can't figure it out  
23:46 <jvelo> I have mvn 3.0.4, java 1.6.0\_24  
23:47 <jvelo> for example building XE UI module does not bring the platform UIs deps in the XAR  
23:51 <jvelo> though they end up in the final database since they're processed when building database  
23:53 <jvelo> mmmh it looks like the behavior was changed on purpose  
23:53 <jvelo> did I miss that  
23:55 <jvelo> OK there's now a includeDependencies in conf.  
23:55 <jvelo> sorry for the noise
